meanings.definition: The act of enrolling in a course or program before the official registration period.
meanings.sent1: Many students secured their preenrollments for the popular class.
meanings.sent2: The preenrollments for next semester's courses are filling up quickly.
meanings.sent3: The preenrollments were like tickets to a sold-out concert.
meanings.sent4: Her preenrollments were a golden opportunity to get ahead.
meanings.sent5: The early preenrollments saved him from the stress of last-minute registration.

meanings.definition: The list of students who have signed up for classes in advance.
meanings.sent1: The preenrollments showed a high interest in the new course.
meanings.sent2: She checked the preenrollments to see if her friends were in the same class.
meanings.sent3: The preenrollments list felt like a sneak peek into the upcoming semester.
meanings.sent4: His name was at the top of the preenrollments, indicating his early commitment.
meanings.sent5: The preenrollments list was a roadmap for the academic advisors.
